Function Documentation

PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_BindComponent ( const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
const t_cm_instance_handle  server,
const char *  providedItfServerName 
)

Bind two components together.

Bind a required interface of a client component with a provided interface of a server component.

This method can be used like this: 

 t_cm_instance_handle client, server;
 t_cm_error error;

 error = CM_BindComponent(
     client,
     "output",
     server,
     "input");

 error = CM_UnbindComponent(
     client,
     "output");

In fact, this method do exactly the same thing as the definition bellow in the architecture file in the static Nomadik Kernel approach:

 binds clientName.output to serverName.input
Parameters:
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] server The server component instance handle.
[in] providedItfServerName The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE Interface name not provided by the component.
CM_ILLEGAL_BINDING Type mismatch between client and server interfaces.
CM_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED Required interface must be unbinded before rebind.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_BindComponentAsynchronous ( const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
const t_cm_instance_handle  server,
const char *  providedItfServerName,
t_uint32  fifosize 
)

Bind two components together in an asynchronous way (the components can be on the same MPC or on two different MPC).

Bind a required interface of a client component with a provided interface of a server component via a asynchronous binding. If client and server components reside on the same MPC then a pure asynchronous binding is created. If they are residing on distinct MPC then a distributed binding is created. This distributed binding automatically marshall parameters directly in the shared memory (DMA is not involve in this binding).

This method can be used like this: 

 t_cm_instance_handle client, server;
 t_cm_error error;

 error = CM_BindComponentAsynchronous(
     client,
     "output",
     server,
     "input",
     4);

 error = CM_UnbindComponentAsynchronous(
     client,
     "output");

In fact, this method do exactly the same thing as the definition bellow in the architecture file in the static Nomadik Kernel approach:

 binds clientName.output to serverName.input
Parameters:
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] server The server component instance handle.
[in] providedItfServerName The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] fifosize the number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request)
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE Interface name not provided by the component.
CM_ILLEGAL_BINDING Type mismatch between client and server interfaces.
CM_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED Required interface must be unbinded before rebind.
CM_BINDING_COMPONENT_NOT_FOUND Binding component require for this binding not found in the component repository.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
CM_INVALID_PARAMETER Invalid parameter (Fifo too bug, ...)
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_BindComponentToVoid ( const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName 
)

Bind a component to void (silently ignore a call).

Bind to void mean that calling a method from this interface do nothing and the caller can continu its execution.

This method can be used like this: 

 t_cm_instance_handle client;
 t_cm_error error;

 error = CM_BindComponentToVoid(
     client,
     "output");

 error = CM_UnbindComponent(
     client,
     "output");
Parameters:
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED Required interface must be unbinded before rebind.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_BindComponentTrace ( const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
const t_cm_instance_handle  server,
const char *  providedItfServerName 
)

Bind two components together with trace.

Bind a required interface of a client component with a provided interface of a server component.

This method can be used like this: 

 t_cm_instance_handle client, server;
 t_cm_error error;

 error = CM_BindComponentTrace(
     client,
     "output",
     server,
     "input");

 error = CM_UnbindComponent(
     client,
     "output");

In fact, this method do exactly the same thing as the definition bellow in the architecture file in the static ADL approach:

 binds clientName.output to serverName.input
Parameters:
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] server The server component instance handle.
[in] providedItfServerName The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE Interface name not provided by the component.
CM_ILLEGAL_BINDING Type mismatch between client and server interfaces.
CM_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED Required interface must be unbinded before rebind.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_DestroyComponent ( t_cm_instance_handle  component  ) 

Destroy a component.

Destroy a previously instanciated component with CM_InstantiateComponent by freeing memories allocated for component instance. This component must been previously stopped using CM_StopComponent.

Furthermore, if it is the last instance of a component template, this method unload it and free all code and shared data memories.

See CM_InstantiateComponent for example.

Exceptions:
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Component must be stopped before perform destroy operation.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_UNBINDED Component must be fully unbinded before perform destroy operation.
CM_MPC_NOT_RESPONDING Fifo not responding to sent command (nevertheless, the component has been stopped)
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_InstantiateComponent ( const char *  templateName,
t_cm_domain_id  domainId,
t_nmf_ee_priority  priority,
const char *  localName,
t_cm_instance_handle *  component 
)

Instantiate a new component.

Instantiate a new component from a specific template type into a specific MPC by allocating memory for component instance inside the MPC memories (XRAM, YRAM, EMBEDDED, EXTERNAL).

If the template has not been loaded yet, this method load the code and the shared read only data inside memories (XROM, YROM, EMBEDDED_ROM, EXTERNAL_ROM, PROG, EMBEDDED_PROG).

This method can be used like this: 

 t_cm_instance_handle mytest;
 t_cm_error error;

 error = CM_InstantiateComponent(
      "test",
      SVA_CORE_ID,
      NMF_SCHED_NORMAL,
      "mytest",
      &mytest);

 error = CM_StartComponent(mytest);

 ...

 error = CM_StopComponent(mytest);

 error = CM_DestroyComponent(mytest);

In fact, this method do exactly the same thing as the definition below in the architecture file in the static NMF approach: 

 contains test as mytest

Concerning Singleton behavior:

  • Same instance handle is returned.
  • First instance of the singleton is instantiated in the domain passed as parameter
  • Binding is immutable and thus first binding will be the winner, other binding must be exactly the same for coherence purpose
  • Component is start during the first start
  • Component is stop during the last stop
  • Each interface required by the singleton is really unbinded when the last binded interface is really unbinded
  • Component is really destroy when the last handle is destroyed Internally client action is memorized in order to correctly manage singleton in multi-process management.
Parameters:
[in] templateName The template type name.
[in] domainId Domain identifier where the component must be instantiated.
[in] priority Priority of the component into the MPC Executive Engine (all the provided interface methods will be executed at this given priority). A sub priority can be given by bitwise or with priority level.
[in] localName A optional name inside the MPC.
[out] component The component instance handle reference.
Exceptions:
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_FOUND The ELF file corresponding to the component template name is not found.
CM_INVALID_ELF_FILE The ELF file is not a MPC ELF file or not conform to the file name.
CM_MPC_NOT_RESPONDING Fifo not responding to sended command
CM_INVALID_DOMAIN_HANDLE Invalid domain handle
CM_NO_MORE_MEMORY No more memory
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_PushComponent ( const char *  templateName  ) 

Components Component Manager API.

This file contains the Component Manager API for manipulating components.

Push a file component in the Component Manager file cache.

PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_ReadComponentAttribute ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component,
const char *  attrName,
t_uint24 *  value 
)

Read a value on an attribute exported by a component instance.

This attribute must have been declared as an attribute in the component configuration file.

Warning:
{ Be careful, only attribute filling in one MPC word could be get through this method.

Thus on MMDSP only attribute of t_[u|s]int[24|16|8] could be well returned. Elsewhere, only one part of attribute could be returned. }

This method can be used like this: 

 t_cm_instance_handle component;
 t_cm_error error;
 t_uint24 value;

 error = CM_ReadComponentAttribute(
       component,
       "count",
       &value);
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle.
[in] attrName The component attribute name.
[out] value Read value
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_ATTRIBUTE Attribute name not provide by a component.
CM_INVALID_COMPONENT_HANDLE 
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_StartComponent ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component  ) 

Start execution of a component.

Start a component which has been fully configured and which has all required interfaces binded.

See CM_InstantiateComponent for example.

Exceptions:
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Component already started.
CM_REQUIRE_INTERFACE_UNBINDED Each required interfaces must be binded before starting a component.
CM_MPC_NOT_RESPONDING Fifo not responding to sent command and the component was not started
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_StopComponent ( const t_cm_instance_handle  component  ) 

Stop execution of a component.

Stop a component previously started using CM_StartComponent.

See CM_InstantiateComponent for example.

Exceptions:
CM_COMPONENT_WAIT_RUNNABLE Start acknowledgment must be receive before stopping it.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STARTED Component must has been started before stopping.
CM_MPC_NOT_RESPONDING Fifo not responding to sent command (nevertheless, the component has been stopped)
Parameters:
[in] component The component instance handle
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_UnbindComponent ( const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName 
)

Unbind a component either traced or not.

Unbind a required interface of a client component previoulsy binded with CM_BindComponent or CM_BindComponentTrace.

See CM_BindComponent for example.

Parameters:
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_INTERFACE_NOT_BINDED The required interface is not binded.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
CM_ILLEGAL_UNBINDING Try to unbind component bind with other binding factories.
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_UnbindComponentAsynchronous ( const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName 
)

Unbind a component previously binded asynchronously.

Unbind a required interface of a client component previoulsy binded with CM_BindComponentAsynchronous.

See CM_BindComponentAsynchronous for example.

Parameters:
[in] client The client component instance handle.
[in] requiredItfClientName The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
Exceptions:
CM_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE Interface name not required by the component.
CM_INTERFACE_NOT_BINDED The required interface is not binded.
CM_COMPONENT_NOT_STOPPED Client component must be stopped before reconfigure it
CM_ILLEGAL_UNBINDING Try to unbind component bind with other binding factories.
